snippet: Dependent on the streams of customers drawn to the neighborhood by Fairway, which was damaged in Hurricane Sandy, the surrounding small businesses wait and worry.
abstract: Small businesses in Red Hook, Brooklyn, which depend on steady stream of customers drawn to the neighborhood by Fairway Market, are suffering as the 52,000-square-foot waterfront grocery store remains closed after flooding from Hurricane Sandy; Fairway, the lifeblood of the neighborhood, is not expected to reopen for months.
lead_paragraph: Dependent on the streams of customers drawn to the neighborhood by Fairway, which was damaged in Hurricane Sandy, the surrounding small businesses wait and worry.

headline.seo: With Fairway in Red Hook Closed, Neighboring Shops Wait and Worry
headline.main: Small Shops Shiver in Gloom of a Shuttered Red Hook Market
headline.print_headline: Small Shops Shiver in Gloom of a Shuttered Red Hook Market
